text.text_translated: It is common to see small animals like birds and squirrels in many cities. But in recent years, the news has reported something new. More wild animals are coming into cities. For example, people have seen bears in Vancouver parks. They have also seen large wild cats on the streets of Mumbai. Wild pigs have appeared in gardens in Berlin. What happens when bigger animals come into our cities? Are they welcome, or are they seen as a danger or a problem?

feedback.feedback: PASS. The text adheres to all B1 criteria. Sentences are short and clear. Vocabulary is appropriate, with good simplifications like 'large wild cats' for 'leopards' and 'problem' for 'pest'. The use of present perfect is simple and correct for the B1 level. Factual accuracy is maintained.
